basics.name: Dylan Kobayashi
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: I am working towards a Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Developing for SAGE2, a software to drive multiple displays as one unified workspace for collaborative multi user interaction.
highlights: Focus towards easy of Windows setup
Helped deploy and setup hardware and provide workshops for new users

work.company: National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science and Technology
work.summary: Assisted their visualization group with presenting sensor data and guiding undergrad interns.
highlights: Setup and configured two tiled display walls
Hosted training workshops for undergrad interns
Cleaned and formatted water sensor data from a Japanese government disaster prevention website. Data was presented in virtual reality and web applications
This internship lead to a publication: [SageRDI](https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?doid=3279778.3279798)

work.company: Army Research Lab at Aberdeen Proving Grounds
work.summary: Assisted in setup and planning of a visualization room.
highlights: Installation, cabling, and configuration of tiled display wall and computer rack
Software integration of  ParaViewWeb(https://www.paraview.org/web/) with  SAGE2(http://sage2.sagecommons.org)
Background security check conducted, obtained interim status during stay
This internship lead to a poster: [ParaSAGE](http://ieeevis.org/year/2016/info/overview-amp-topics/posters)

work.summary: Involved with planning of new equipment for usage in classroom and training teachers
highlights: Installation and maintenance of all electronics on campus
Hosted workshops for teachers regarding equipment / software usage and scenarios
Helped teachers with electronic document generation and records compliance

work.summary: Assisted with ICS 111 (Introduction to programming through Java), 212(Program Structure using C++), and 321(Data Storage & Retrieval). Duties included:
highlights: Grading homework, quizzes, and exams
Create homework and projects (ICS 111 and ICS 212)
Plan and run 45 minute labs to cover topics (ICS 111)
Lecture on class topics (ICS 111)

work.company: Institute for Astronomy, University of Hawaii at Manoa
work.summary: Setup a [KeckCAVES](http://keckcaves.org/about/start) and trained researchers in usage
highlights: Built the mounting structure for the tracking system
Installed and configured software for tracking, controller interface, and rendering
Assisted with cleaning and formatting data for rendering
